mixtral-8x7b_direct_sole-planning_result:
Sure, here's a possible itinerary for your one-week trip to Colorado from Devils Lake, staying within your budget of $3,500:

Day 1 (Mar 22): Depart from Devils Lake

* Self-driving from Devils Lake to Alamosa (duration: 17 hours 26 mins, distance: 1,811 km, cost: 90)

Day 2-3 (Mar 23-24): Explore Alamosa

* Accommodation: Clean and convenient 2BR apartment ($405 for 2 nights)
* Activities: Great Sand Dunes National Park, Rio Grande Scenic Railroad, Zapata Falls, San Luis Valley
* Food: Timboo Cafe, Time To Tea, Cup and Cones, Social on Main

Day 4 (Mar 25): Travel from Alamosa to Grand Junction

* Self-driving from Alamosa to Grand Junction (duration: 4 hours 29 mins, distance: 396 km, cost: 19)

Day 5-6 (Mar 26-27): Explore Grand Junction

* Accommodation: Spacious Bed and Bathroom in Brooklyn ($406 for 2 nights)
* Activities: Colorado National Monument, Museum of the West, James M. Robb - Colorado River State Park, Downtown Grand Junction
* Food: Larry's China - Taj Vivanta, Raj Rasoi, Social on Main, Timboo Cafe

Day 7 (Mar 28): Return to Devils Lake

* Self-driving from Grand Junction to Devils Lake (duration: 17 hours 30 mins, distance: 1,881 km, cost: 94)

Total Costs:

* Transportation: $123 (self-driving: $123)
* Accommodation: $811 ($405 x 2 nights in Alamosa + $406 x 2 nights in Grand Junction)
* Activities: ~$75 (estimated cost for parks and museums)
* Food: ~$150 (estimated cost for meals, assuming $30 per day)
* Total: $1,139 + $2,361 (budget left) = $3,499 (within the budget of $3,500)

Note: The above itinerary is just a suggestion and can be adjusted based on your preferences. Also, please note that some activities may have additional costs or restrictions due to COVID-19. Safe travels!
